website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option for a convenient, highly portable sound card for small laptops.
pros: Simple design sports a single headphone and microphone jack
Card offers decent protection against audio interference
Can be used with gaming devices
cons: Audio card often lacks higher volume levels for gaming and movie viewing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a gaming headset for my PS4, but the light feature was powered by USB, and had to use an adapter for mic&headphone, but the USB cord is to short to reach my console while headset was plugged into my controller. So I found this adapter so that I may use the light feature and my headset. I am very happy with this adapter, works great with PS4. Will definitely recommend this to other PS4 gamers!!
customer_reviews.author: Alchemyst

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My Nintendo Switch is connected to a monitor through DVI. Normally I plug a 3.5mm cable from the speaker to the Switch’s 3.5mm port to get my sound working and its a little inconvenient doing it whenever I dock my Switch which also makes a lot of static sound in the process. Since the Switch supports USB audio, this adapter works like charm. The sound is if not the same, better than just plugging to the 3.5mm port from the Switch to the speaker. I’m satisfied so far. I hope its durable enough. For now my rating is a perfect 5/5
customer_reviews.author: JMAC

customer_reviews.title: Worked great out of the box (on a Raspberry Pi 3B)
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box on a Raspberry Pi 3B, no issues, no special drivers or configuration (I was using Ubuntu Mate 16.04.02). The cord (versus similar ones that are a hard plastic dongle with no cord) makes it easier to deal with the closeness of the USB ports on the Pi, as you can get the larger adapter portion away from the body. Labels on the two ports are a bit hard to see in dim light but are color coded.
customer_reviews.author: Linwood

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility is a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of equipment. We have used other USB audio adapters in the past and had to replace them over time because they broke. This model has a cord so the audio plug ins are not connected directly to the computer and in danger of being bumped and damaged from lack of flexibility. Unit is used to transmit from the main computer to our sound system and cords are in danger of being bumped and moved on a daily basis so the cord has saved us many times. We have had this model longer than any other unit we have used and have had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Donovan

customer_reviews.title: This works fine but it definitely lacks power
customer_reviews.text: This works fine but it definitely lacks power. Compared to the BEHRINGER U-Control Uca202 that I purchased at the same time, something is clearly different. What's most noticeable is that the competing option is much louder--when I used this to play audio from a Galaxy tablet through my car's auxiliary input, the volume was so muted that it really wasn't a viable option for that purpose. The pro with this device, however, is that it is truly plug-and-play, so if you just need something to plug your headphones into a device with a bad audio jack, then this will probably be okay for you.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter because the headphone jack on my laptop broke, this worked perfectly.... when I first got it. And then after 4 days, it started disconnecting randomly, and then it eventually just stopped connecting at all. I tried this thing on multiple USB ports, changed some settings within Windows, and restarted my laptop MULTIPLE TIMES, and NOTHING FIXED THE PROBLEM!! (And I know it's not the USB ports because I plugged other stuff into said ports and they worked just fine) I am beyond upset right now.
customer_reviews.author: awildmew

customer_reviews.title: Saves HOURS getting Linux to run on a Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I got a used Acer CB315 Chromebook for a great price. I bought it to load Linux and test things before putting Linux on machines I cared about. Linux Min 19 works great on the Chromebook, but power management and sound features aren't there yet. As soon as I plugged this into the system, Linux recognized it and I had mono sound in and stereo sound out. I'm sure I'll get the native sound working someday. Meanwhile, this saved me HOURS on the setup and makes the Chromebook completely usable on Linux Mint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm! I have sound again.
customer_reviews.text: I recently had my computer stop recognizing my speakers. As far as I can tell this is due to some driver issue occurring through a Windows 10 update or a hardware failure. Manually adjusting the driver did not work. Having to wear my headset constantly was getting very frustrating. This fixed my problem instantly. Plugged in with sound again! Such a simple device that works great! The audio is super clear also, possibly better than before. Don't hesitate to try this out if you are having a similar issue after trying all the fixes you can find online.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: It works! UPDATE: Not anymore!
customer_reviews.text: No setup required, it just worked as soon as I plugged it in. The audio jack on my Asus N550JV laptop is busted. So the only way to connect my Astro A10 headphones to it was to get 3.5mm to USB adapter. And this one works great. Especially since the headphones come with a splitter that separates the headset and microphone into different lines, and this adapter accepts both of those lines simultaneously. UPDATE : After about a month, it suddenly stopped working. At first I thought it was driver issues, but it doesn't work on any device. It still sends audio to the headphones, but microphone signals no longer work.
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Audio Adapter
customer_reviews.text: There are many external audio adapters on the market, and most of them may work very well. My only experience is with this one, and I was very pleased with the quality of the audio. My new HP EliteDesk model came with only a front audio connection, which is not convenient for connecting an exterior sound system. The USB audio adapter was just what I needed. Plug it into a rear USB slot, and that's it. Now I can play music through my external speakers without cluttering up the front of the PC, which is pretty small to start with. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Fooled Again.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended as "Amazon's Choice?" Seriously? It is complete junk. Works fine for a few minutes - then stops. The only way to get it to work again is to remove it and plug it back in. (And when I say "work again" I mean for another few minutes.) I see that I'm not the only one to have experienced the same issue. Again, this is a product that Amazon recommends we buy. My experience is symptomatic of a trend I've been noticing with Amazon. They are becoming a clearing house for cheaply made junk coming from across the Pacific. I'm finding myself buying less and less through this sight. It's not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Harpring

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!!
customer_reviews.text: When my old Sound Blaster sound card died, I thought I would save money, so bought this because of the price, but very disappointed!! The microphone jack never worked from the get-go, and it quit working completely within a couple of weeks! I ordered a second one, thinking that it may have been a lemon, but this one also is defective! Sound quality on mike jack was terrible!! And the whole thing only worked for a few weeks as well. Going back to the Sound Blaster that served me well for 5+ years before it died!! How don't know how it earned such great reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Health Foodie

customer_reviews.title: I was shocked.
customer_reviews.text: I was Shocked at how easy this little device Solved My Problem. I needed another sound port for my little computer (Long Story). After looking at this thing online I was saying to myself: "This can't possibly work, hugh?" So I took a chance. It arrived in the mail a few day later; I plugged it into an open usb slot; plugged my headphones into the headphone port, and dang if the sound didn't flood my ears! I was amazed at how easy, and cheap, it was to solve what I thought was going to be a big problem. IF they continue to work as they are working now.....I would be MORE THAN SATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Nickels

customer_reviews.title: Works well for sharing the speakers between my Nintendo Switch and PC Line In
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to connect my PC Line In to my Nintendo Switch without having to plug directly into the top port on the Switch. This worked perfectly after re-plugging in the Line In port on my PC, so if it's not working for you at first, try reconnecting the 3.5mm male end on the Line In. Now I can undock my Switch without having to disconnect the 3.5mm jack every time and having a loose cable. Haven't tested the microphone jack yet, but I expect it will work flawlessly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Troy O.

customer_reviews.title: Can't power the microphone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could use my microphone to record music with the static buzz of my onboard line-in. There was no visible damage to the unit upon receiving it, but when I tried it out, my microphone wasn't putting anything out. I tried plugging my headphones into it and that worked, but my microphone would not. I've read some reviews that talked about the unit not being able to power their mics, but I ignored them because of the overwhelming volume of positive reviews. Now I see I should have heeded the others' warnings. Cannot recommend and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: jlamb642@cougarmail.cccc.edu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a USB mic, and the adapter/external sound card that came with it was causing a terrible buzzing/hissing. At first I wasn't sure if it was the adapter, but this confirmed that it was. Love that its literally plug and play, and the sound is perfect - no background noise, hissing or buzzing. This also supplies enough power from a laptop, to a mic that requires phantom power. And most of all its such an inexpensive item, I was more than willing to purchase this than to go through the hassle of contacting the Cust Service of the USB mic. Very satisfied and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Poor Microphone Performance
customer_reviews.text: My experience is tat the micro phone was unable to be boosted sufficiently to accommodate a mic. I even installed software (Equalizer APO w/ Peace AddIn and Audacity, each freeware GNU and sound (no pun) reviews) Using it with a Panasonic Headset designed for phones with mono mic and audio. More adapters than I would like (1-2.5 mm, 3 pole into 3.5mm, 4 pole out to 2 3.55mm, 3 pole for mic and audio. All on an HP G70-257 CL Notebook running Win7 Pro, 32bit. Nothing readily available thru HP either. but for the $14, durinng this pandemic, I'll eat the cost.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product. Stellar service!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those objects that I didn't know existed until it was the most important "treasure" I was seeking. My husband's pc's headphone jack broke and that's not a good situation for either of us. I called to inquire how much and more importantly-how long? Motherboard was mentioned and I quit hearing. "But" he said, "you can get a USB soundcard headphones jack adapter." I live in a small rural town so Amazon was my best bet. It was here in 2 days,easy to use,well made,sounds good and the dogs and I will make it through the weekend. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Phoebee47

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Emergency Sound Card
customer_reviews.text: Got this after my current and soon-to-be retired desktop's on-board sound kicked the bucket full circle. Not much to the packaging or the device as you can see, true plug-and-play on Windows 10 (no drivers required, shows up as a USB Audio Device.) Sound quality is excellent and clear in both directions without distortion. Yet another device that has a short and stiff cable though, and the mic in is sadly mono only (I have stereo lavalier microphones that I use.) This device is definitely staying in the tool box once my new system is complete though.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: The mic hole actually works.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike a competitor's product, which I purchased first (and then had to return), the microphone jack on this little fella actually works. Also, the headphone jack sounds a lot better (which is interesting, since the competitor still sounded significantly better than motherboard audio.) Only inconvenient thing is that it comes in a baggie bent a certain way, and doesn't want to unbend easily -- so if you want this on the LEFT side of your laptop, you'll have an easier time than if you want it on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for sound card problems
customer_reviews.text: Had a fairly new computer that had intermittent sound problems. I could get sound to work by deleting drivers and rebooting. After a few minutes, the sound would drop out again. Tried a driver update program that seemed to help a little but problem persisted. Found this USB sound adapter. What a great idea. I just haven't had much problem with USB ports over the years and this adapter gives me reliable and great sound. I bought a spare in case one of my other 15 computers gives me problems.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schlenger

customer_reviews.title: saved my sanity
customer_reviews.text: One of the biggest issues (asides from windows updates) on my newest QEMU virtual PC is sound. getting sound to pass through the "vmtools" equivalent driver was next to impossible without hearing it getting chopped up worse than speaking upwint into a metal fan. I found the easiest way was to get a decent sound was to plug this into the usb card passed through to my virtual machine, and then put the "speaker out" into the "line in" on the motherboard sound card, turn on loopback in the host mixer settings and away we go. great sound, as long as your not looking for 5.1/7.1
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Switch compatible!
customer_reviews.text: If you plug this into your Nintendo Switch dock, you can adjust the volume of the switch while docked! It's recognized instantly, no configs or updates required. No more finding your TV's remote control: you can *finally* just use the joy-cons. It's also tiny, fits nicely out the back flap of the switch dock, has a well-fitting headphone port, and produces plenty of volume with very little noise. Very happy with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Albertine

customer_reviews.title: Works good , both Headphones and Mic work at the same time 11
customer_reviews.text: Some good stuff , works with headphones and mic AT the same time , so for the price I am able to use an inexpensive mic to talk to Siri and my ref. Sony headphones for my 70+ album iTunes collection. My cost for the adapter and mic was 16.98 , not bad. IMPORTANT : READ THIS > YOU NEED A MICRO PHONE THAT LOOKS LIKE IT HAS A STEREO PLUG (TRS) , IF IT LOOKS LIKE A MONO MIC , IT WILL NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Fan #2952

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for my Sennheiser GSP 600 and its breakout cable. This little plastic box is NOT capable of providing power to the microphone. Consequently, the mic does not work with this product. The headphone jack works fine, but is no improvement over on-board sound. To be fair, the manufacturer does not say the product enhances sound output. Consequently, if the mic jack does not provide gain and the headphone jack provides no benefits, then this plastic thing is a piece of junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: No Theme Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2012 Toshiba laptop, and it is in desperate need for repair. Being a student and living on a fixed income, I do the best with what I've got. Since the headphone jack no longer works on my laptop, I just use this sound card, and it works just like the headphone jack; even better, I say. I do recommend purchasing this product if you are like me and can't shell out the money to get the laptop or your gaming system repaired.
customer_reviews.author: FunkyFresh Diva

customer_reviews.title: saved me from having to rebuild my computer.
customer_reviews.text: After one of the (many updates to windows) my sound went away. I tried everything to make it work short of re-installing windows. I tried reloading drivers, going back on the update, and replacing the speakers. Nothing worked. I bought this and it came the next day and works well. I no longer use it as as if the Windows fairy felt sorry for me and fixed the problem in another endless update, it did what i needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Bob0a

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a lot of trouble
customer_reviews.text: Use my computer for work and the sound card on the motherboard stopped working after an update. Got this card as a stop-gap to have sound and microphone while troubleshooting the problem. This card worked immediately and I was back up and running. The next driver update fixed the motherboard problem, but it's nice to have this card as a back-up. Have been playing with a Raspberry Pi and various distributions of Linux, and the card works with that as well. Recommend this card highly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Easy Alternative To Onboard Sound
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the onboard audio on my daughters PC stopped working. It's not a driver issue and I assume it has something to do with it having a refurbished motherboard. This was an easy and low cost solution compared to buying a dedicated sound card or replacing the motherboard. It doesn't have any fancy features, nor would I expect it to as this price range. My daughter can plug in her headphones and hear things again! Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Talon4

customer_reviews.title: Work really good
customer_reviews.text: I was in hurry to make live streaming for a religious temple. I think I was lucky because I found this. This was working really good with the Yamaha audio mixer to output the sound to the Macbook and iPhone (I used usb-c hub and apple lightning adapter to make it transfer signal to these devices). Worked perfectly. After a lot of ways and devices I tried on the mixer to make it work for live streaming with good sound from the mixer, I ended up using this.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.....for two months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this adapter because the headphone port on my 2012 Macbook Pro had been having issues. It worked great - just plugged it into my USB port and plugged my headphones into the input on the adapter. Crystal-clear sound, no need to download a driver. I was thrilled. Unfortunately, two months later the adapter has completely stopped working. It is not recognized by my laptop at all. I've tested both USB inputs - they work fine with flash drives, mice and other USB inputs - it's just this USB audio adapter that does not work. In a word, this product is disappointing. I would recommend against purchasing this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Kaplan-good

customer_reviews.title: just buy a real sound card
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really bad and is too low. It doesn't let you have bass or you can have just bass, if you have better speakers. If you move the cable a little it stops working and you have to unplug then plug in again. Maybe good in emergencies or if all you had was a crappy laptop and needed sound, and if it was cheaper. Yes its better than no sound. But I would have just bought a decent pci sound card instead.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Does its job really well
customer_reviews.text: My work-issues work laptop works fine, but it has a strange issue where if I disconnect the headphone/speaker output and then plug it back in, the sound continues to play from the laptop instead of sending the sound out the headphone/speaker jack. Instead of getting work's IT dept involved, I just got this USB soundcard and now my problem is solved. It's simple, inexpensive, and has been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Nerditup

customer_reviews.title: A simple fix for a bad audio Jack
customer_reviews.text: My title says it all. My audio jack stopped working and I wasn't about to spend $100's of dollars for an expensive repair. This simple audio jack solved the problem Furthermore, laptops in the past came with audio jacks that had two ports--one for the speaker and the other for mic. The newer models come with only one audio jack for both. I can't understand how this is an "upgrade". If I use the jack as a mic, then I cannot listen to the recording unless I unhook the mic. This little part corrects the "upgrade" issue. Dr. Charles Rasmussen
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Addition to a Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This adapter is a simple and convenient way to increase the number of laptop's audio ports (usually a single combined headphones/microphone one). The product page is very informative with clear pictures and descriptions of all characteristics, uses, possible connections, etc. The downside is that it will occupy a USB port, which number is usually also very limited. So, a USB hub might be needed. On the other hand, if all that is required is to connect a headset and microphone to a laptop, a simple adapter like thismight be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Nekto

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Raspberry Pi - provides a mike input.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an external sound card with a microphone input, because the Pi doesn't have one. This is super easy to use if you are using Ubuntu Mate. Plug it in, power up the pi, and select "USB Audio Device" from the drop down menus in the system area. Thats it. No mucking around in linux and editing config files. Works great with FLDigi for Ham Radio. I have received several RTTY transmissions and had conversations in CW, all through the Pi and this sound card.
customer_reviews.author: theosus

customer_reviews.title: This fixed my son's Nintendo Switch audio output to his capture card
customer_reviews.text: My son is an avid gaming streamer who streams his Nintendo Switch via a capture card plugged into my PC. When we tried plugging a 3.5mm audio cable directly from the output of the switch into the PC, it had a lot of interference/noise. I'm happy to report, this little device plugs into the USB port on the Nintendo Switch base station and when I plugged the 3.5mm audio cable into it and the PC, crystal clear sound is what we got!!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Amended review
customer_reviews.text: It works. However if you have already established a profile with another adapter, you'll have to start all over again. I wanted to have one in each room but they are not compatible. So I will have to open a new profile and teach it from scratch. Other than that it works as advertised. Not to mention how quick it got here with Prime membership. Update: It's mic input died on me. So down goes the rating. I am using one I found at a garage sale and it has lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: So glad that I didn't have to replace the laptop motherboard a second time because of breaking the onboard headphone jack again.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality seems better than the original on-board headphone jack that was unfortunately destroyed when the laptop fell on it's side with headphones plugged in. The adapter sound is loud and clear on my vintage Compaq Presario CQ62 AMD laptop with Windows 10 Home version 1803. To get it working, I just needed to disable the onboard sound and click on Windows 10 Sound troubleshoot program. It then automatically defaulted to "Speakers (USB audio device)." I haven't tested the microphone port yet but I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Molina Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After dropping my laptop with my headphones in and messing up my headphone port, I've been using USB Audio Adapters for the past couple years. I used to use TurtleBeach USB Audio Adapters but they give off a very annoying white noise sound based on where they're plugged in, and I've had issues with them dying on me in the post. I've had this one for about 2 months and I've had no such issues. It's portable, lightweight but sturdy, gets the jobs done without any static/feedback noises, and provides excellent audio/mic quality.
customer_reviews.author: zn

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix for a noisy 3.5mm Raspberry PI 3 jack
customer_reviews.text: Got my first Raspberry PI 3 the other day and was disheartened to learn that the 3.5mm jack had some seriously bad hiss/hum. I tried Librelec and Openelec. Openelec had far worse results. So I got online and searched for a result. Turns out it's a common issue with the PI. I found out some use a device just like this device. I got the device today...plugged it in...went into system settings and changed the default to alsa usb analog...voila!!! Everything works great. Sound is crystal clear and loud. Worth the $8. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rhodie1

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ever. I plug in any kind of thing into the headphone jack. Put it in the usb of whatever I need it for, and it just works. Right now I'm using a peripheral switcher for my Macbook and Windows 10 computers. I have my speakers plugged into a 3 to 1 3.5mm converter that plugs into the usb aux port and then plug all that into the peripheral switcher. The result? I have my 5.1 logitech speakers that switch between my Windows 10 and MacOS computers with the a simple click on the peripheral switch and thats it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Collier

customer_reviews.title: Fixed sound problem on my computer
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know if this improved the sound on my laptop because the sound never worked.. But this gave me sound through USB port and it seems to be high quality.. I'm very happy with this device.. All I had to do was disable the non-functioning sound profile through the control panel and it self installs while plugging in... I nearly blew my ears out with headphones on.... It does push it out.. Seems to be well built too.. I haven't used the microphone port yet on it but I plan to.. Just make sure you disable sound devices that are set to default and enable this for it to work..
customer_reviews.author: Neal Vanderstelt

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for an XP machine!
customer_reviews.text: I repurposed an older laptop as a Windows XP machine (don't ask how long that took to get working). Anyhow, I needed an XP machine to program some old show control hardware. The only problem was, the onboard sound device never had XP drivers created for it, which pretty much made the whole computer useless since I'm programming automated shows with sound. This little device saved my butt bigtime! Plugged it in and the device installed the drivers automatically! Thank you to the folks who made this, and can sell them at such a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: Cost-effective way to use my non-USB headset with a laptop lacking audio ports
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this product. I had a headset that I really liked, but my laptop didn't have microphone and audio jacks, only USB ports. I've been using this adapter for a few months now, and I've been happy with the sound quality and the reliability of the product. Highly recommend, with the caveat that I'm not a sound aficionado, just someone who enjoys playing Guild Wars 2 and talking with people on Discord.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Bose Companion 20 which all of a sudden my apple computer will not recognize anymore after using it for over 2 years. I thought it was the speaker but it works with my other computer. I search the web and found out I am not alone and there were plenty of people that their Apple Mac dropped their speaker after an update. I found the solution after 8 months by accident: use USB audio adapter external stereo sound card and everything is fine- sound is great and no distortion of sound like a Bose speaker. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria W.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Must've gotten a bad adapter because the audio input doesn't work. The output is fine, if not a bit quiet. I picked this up hoping to eliminate the slight hum when plugging in the mic directly to my laptop. When plugged into this adapter it's very muffled. Tried different USB ports, no luck. I'm using this with my Sennheiser PC37X UPDATE: After posting my previous review, the seller immediately contacted me and sent me a replacement. The replacement worked! Thank you for sending me a free replacement. I'm now happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: my sound card was damaged so i couldn't use the 3mm jack on my pc. but my problem is solved with this! no deterioration in sound quality that i can discern. works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: C. John

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked, but broke too soon
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a low-cost solution to get audio out of a Surface 3 who's docking station's audio port broke down. The UGREEN device worked quite well for about 3 months, and then the problems started. The device now only provides sound out of the left headphone channel. I thought that, though odd, it might be a software problem or maybe a problem with the docking station itself, but sadly this was not the case. I must suggest looking for another brand and hope for higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Plug-n-Play is nice; doesn't take up too much room
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I bought it to use with a mic/headphone headset I use for gaming; the headset had both a mic and a headphone port but my computer (which had a built-in mic that failed because it is really old) only has the headphone jack. It is a plug-n-play, with no additional software needed to make your devices work. An extra feature I appreciate about this version that others do not have is that it has the extended cable, so if you have USB ports that are very close together on your computer like I do, you can still use the other ports.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Plourde

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my laptop's microphone port is extremely noisy. Any microphone connected to it produces a ghastly mechanical hiss. This microphone jack works perfectly. The speaker port works fine, too, but I don't honestly care about it. Product works out of the box on my Linux machine—no setup required at all. Reported as "Audio Adapter (Unitek Y-247A) Analog Stereo."
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I used this with my Raspberry Pi 3B
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts, but it was cheap, so I ordered it. The Pi has mediocre sound performance at best, and I was targeting this as my music player at work. I needed better quality. This did pretty well. I'm sure there's better out there....just not less than $10. If you need to improve the sound quality out of your Pi without spending a lot, this is the sound ad on for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rod M. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for my problem.
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with the built in microphone input on my work computer. This solved that problem and the audio quality sounds perfectly find. The sound quality when plugging headphones into this isn't anything to write home about but I don't use it for that purpose. If you need an easy 1/8 microphone input look no further.
customer_reviews.author: a single white female

customer_reviews.title: NO STEREO INPUT although advertised as stereo
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to use this product to rip vinyl records. BUT IT IS MONAURAL EVEN THOUGH ADVERTISED AS STEREO! That information only shows up if you read the product details. It also shows up in an Amazon search for ripping vinyl. And now that I'm finally trying to use it I'm past the return window. Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Dramatically Improved Audio Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this little adapter to use with my USB-C dock and my Dell ultraportable laptop so that I would not have to plug in the stereo jack from my Logitech 2.1 speaker set every time I docked the laptop. I've been using Logitech speaker systems with subs forever and was underwhelmed with my current setup, but thought 'whatever, it works and I'm not gaming, just listening to music". I am SHOCKED at how much this gadget improved the clarity, bass response, mids, highs EVERYTHING in my streamed music quality over the base sound card in the laptop. You can't go wrong with this thing - just buy it and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter
customer_reviews.text: So I needed to pull sound from some old cassette tapes before they deteriorated further. My computer doesn't have a microphone-in jack, hence my use of the adapter. It worked so well that I also started relying on it for my headphone jack to the computer (I port sound to better speakers using the headphone jack). Since my computer headphone jack is near where I operate the mouse, this reduced space conflicts on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: ChopperOne74

customer_reviews.title: Improve audio recording on your laptop
customer_reviews.text: So far, the sound quality with this device is significantly better than the default audio on my laptop. I purchased this for recording podcast audio because my laptop only has one input/output 3.5mm socket, and I wanted to have a microphone in line and a line out for headphones. This sound card has worked perfectly for my use and has provided very good sound quality as well. For the price, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Griffen

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would call plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it into a USB port that is an adapter to my MacBook Pro and nothing happened. I scrolled down the Amazon page for this device and noticed they talk about going into Settings/Sound and turning on USB. Glad I noticed this. It worked after I did this. This info should come with the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: McNystrom

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Go!
customer_reviews.text: This adapter works great! Just plugged it in to my server motherboard, Windows 10 detected it, and it worked immediately. It doesn't get simpler than that. If you have a broken sound controller on your system, I recommend this as a quick resolution as opposed to replacing the motherboard or adding a sound card. No hassle to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: It works! And now I have a audio back on my desktop !
customer_reviews.text: this thing saved me! My audio went out in my computer and I had no idea why, I had a tech come out and try to figure out as well, so ordering this was my last resort of getting audio back on my desktop, and I am so happy to say I now have audio thanks to this device. I like how it has a little cord on it so I was able to plug it into the back USB port of my desktop and I have my speakers plugged in. Oh did I mention I was so excited to have sound back on my desktop! :-)
customer_reviews.author: TJ WEBER

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Says "Awesome"
customer_reviews.text: When the headphone jack bit the dust on my daughter's laptop, she begged for one of these. I wanted to get her a good one, since she's on her compy so much her headphones are just about fused permanently to her head. We're about 10 months in since she got it and it's been worth every penny. Bought an extra in case the son needs one one day.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Howle

customer_reviews.title: Find a better product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the absolute worst adapter I've ever used. For starters, I didn't even have to unpack it all the way to see the poor material used. The sound quality somehow makes my headphones sound worse and there is a constant buzzing coming from my microphone. It sounds so much better just plugging my externals without this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mikewho Cheeseitchy

customer_reviews.title: Not a Stereo INPUT
customer_reviews.text: This product implies that it has stereo input but it does not. Using the Windows' microphone properties reveals that it has 1 channel mono recording. It may show up in recording programs as having stereo but the left and right channels are the same mono track. This is not an issue if the use case is to use this with a headset with separate headphone and microphone jacks. This was an issue for me as I need 2 mono channels (Left and Right Stereo) to record a podcast with two people. Returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D'Amato

customer_reviews.title: Adapter does not recognize the microphone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item also on 5/9/2019, to use as an adapter for my Sennheiser GSP 300 gaming headset. I can hear sound through the headset through the UGREEN USB Audio Adapter External Stereo Sound Card, but the microphone will not work. I went to your website and downloaded the windows 10 driver. Also, I configured the Audio Adapter with the Recording and Playback tabs in Windows as you instructed. May I get contacted to fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly died
customer_reviews.text: I usually record a podcast and some videos with this thing and it worked great for the first little while. Then one day I plugged it in, tested my audio, started the recording and about 10 minutes in, it just died. I attempted to use other USB ports but it will not show up as a device for either input or output. Adobe Audition will at least see the device but simply states that it's "Not Working". I know my USB ports are not to blame because I've switched stuff around and all the ports are fine. Very disappointed that it would simply die for no reason!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Use your analog headphones again!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality DAC. Macbook pro doesn't have analog output. Plug this UGREEN USB dongle into an available USB digital port. In System Preferences, click on Sound (speaker) icon and select Output as USB Audio Device. Plug headphones into the green female mini-stereo jack. Voila! My old AKG headphones work again! I had almost forgotten how great high quality stereo sounds!
customer_reviews.author: georgie girl

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Raspberry PI 3B+ from booting
customer_reviews.text: I had intended to use this USB sound card with a Raspberry PI 3B+ as an Airplay host (using shairport-sync). Unfortunately, when this USB sound card is connected to the 3B+ it won't boot. It throws errors regarding the SD card. If I unplug this USB sound card the 3B+ boots up just fine. I tried two different 3B+s, two different power supplies. None of them would boot with this thing plugged in. However, it did work fine with an older Raspberry Pi 3B (non-plus), so that's what I'm using.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I use this adapter plugged into my Nintendo Switch dock to output sound from my docked switch to my USB speakers. Yes you can just plug in a cord to the headphone adapter, but using this is a very inexpensive quality of life improvement for anyone that docks their switch to play on their computer monitor and wants to run sound out to a USB speaker.
customer_reviews.author: SlickyDee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. After reading all the good things I was excited. I bought the Sennheiser GAME ONE Gaming Headset which needed a little boost on sound, so I thought buying the adapter should give me the boost I wanted. I got a little more sound out of it, actually it was perfect. Any louder I'd be loosening up ear wax. My problem is with the microphone, it completely distorted the sound. I made adjustments and they didnt help. If anyone owns these headphones I'd like to know what you did to adjust the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan N.

customer_reviews.title: Nearby components may cause interference-type hum
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good from this card. However, I'm experiencing a humming noise through my stereo speakers when using the card. I know it's related to the card, because unplugging the card makes it go away. It seems to be interference-related. It's not noticeable during movies so much, but definitely present when nothing is currently playing.
customer_reviews.author: Wasatch Rebel

customer_reviews.title: I expected it to work
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on my win10 HP laptop with no sound caused by Win 10 updates-didn't work Tried it on my HP desktop with latest Win 10 updates with sound, locked up my sound card, uninstalled the USB got my sound card back but had to delete other files which were not deleted with uninstall. Never got and any sound on my headset on either computer. After reading that it was for an external sound card it was probably my mistake to order it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my laptop
customer_reviews.text: I needed an adapter to connect a headset with two jacks (speaker and microphone) to my Windows 10 laptop, which doesn't ports for both jacks. (I use the headset both for voice recording, and for listening to various audio sources; I'm not a gamer). This device plugs into one of my USB2.0 ports, comes up fine, and the audio quality is fine. I've had no problems after a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Works great, high fidelity, low/no static or hiss, feels chintzy though
customer_reviews.text: I use in conjunction with an Audio Technica M50 and Antlion Modmic. I purchased this for two reasons: I wanted an external adapter, because I once broke a 3.5mm jack on a motherboard a decade ago and ever since I've been averse to it, I also wanted to eliminate the feedback I'd been getting off the motherboard. This product dealt with both sufficiently and I'm satisfied. The build quality is sufficient. Nothing to write home about, and I wouldn't expect it to last a long time if you're constantly switching jacks in and out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Keene

customer_reviews.title: Microphone static With ModMic 4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter to fix the static noise coming off of the modmic 4 (EMI from my computer), While it did help there was still a lot of static. I even tried plugging into a USB extension cable to bring it even farther away from the computer and there was still static, it wasn't the microphone, because midway through my voice test I decided to unplug the microphone thinking the static would stop, I then realized it was coming off of the adapter itself. It's not even worth returning, as the shipping cost is almost half the price of the adapter. Next time I'll try my luck at Walmart for another device, At least returning it would be easy
customer_reviews.author: Kainon

customer_reviews.title: Works incredibly well. I bought this to deal with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly well. I bought this to deal with an unruly ultra-book that I'm running Linux on. This worked out of the box and was available as an ALSA device with the correct number of inputs and outputs. The cord is a little short and inflexible, but that was okay in my use case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this in to my Windows 10 computer and Windows automatically found and installed the needed drivers. I plugged in my Bose QC15 headphone and they sound great, no static or interference that you sometimes get with audio through USB. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fix to Expensive Repair
customer_reviews.text: As the pastor of a church, I value every penny given to our Lord. When a lap top fell, the sound jack broke off the mother board inside. To repair it, it would have about couple hundred dollars. This only cost a few dollars. You can't tell a difference with the speaker system that we have. It was a cheap easy fix with quality performance.
customer_reviews.author: pastorvoll

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Easy Quick Solve for Bad Onboard Sound
customer_reviews.text: Audio onboard failed. Tried a PCIe card but is was blurry/awful. Tried for hous to fix --no luck. This little item solved it in 10 seconds!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chucklesclown

customer_reviews.title: Laptop Sound Card Failed, This is a Great Work Around for that!
customer_reviews.text: My Laptop Audio Ports that are integrated into the Motherboard would randomly start making sounds and going in and out. Purchased this as a Quick, Low-Cost alternative and it did the job perfectly! I would recommend this to anyone needing Audio to work on a Laptop that is having trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Barron Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for great audio with usb connection!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the one without cable all in one piece with the usb end on the other side of the jack before, and it broke miserably because moving the laptop while having the headphones plugged with that kind of adapter made it break very easily. So this one here is perfect because with the cable extension allows you to move your laptop and not mess with the actual usb connection, so you don't risk to bend it or break it, and the sound comes out very clean, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: antonio

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan.
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job, but only moderately well. I can use my headphones from a USB port. Where this product fails is in reliability. Sometimes the computer stops recognizing it. Sometimes the audio shorts out and I have to physically adjust the adapter until sound comes back. I've had it just over a month. I wouldn't recommend this one -- there are plenty others out there to try.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Better than my old sound card!
customer_reviews.text: Plug, reboot, play -- and on a Ubuntu 19.04 computer, too. A little noise leaks through, so not a complete audiophile part, but I could probably suppress more noise with a better-shielded cable. But the audio spectrum is acceptably linear and extends to 20 kHz.
customer_reviews.author: True-Do

customer_reviews.title: Good for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Plug-n-go with Linux and Pulseaudio. OK sound, good enough for music listening and game playing - nothing impressive, but it is a low cost addon. I use this to power a nice set of headphones, and use Puseaudio to switch from the on-board sound to this and the headphones so that I don't have to add wear to the headphone jack.
customer_reviews.author: Yui Daoren

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient for front usb ports and 3.5mm gaming headsets
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sound is crisp and clean. Been playing games like PUBG, Battlefront, Battlefield with an older headset/mic that uses 3.5mm audio jacks in the rear of the case which is a pain in the neck to connect/disconnect so using the front usb port is very convenient. This sounds just as good or perhaps better than the onboard audio processor.
customer_reviews.author: A. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Impressive DAC
customer_reviews.text: I am no 'audio enthusiast' (= spends a ton of dough for specs) but I have always had an appreciation for high fidelity music. This device does a really nice job of reproducing my NAS-stored m4a files to crisp audio with great presence through a pair of Kanto YU4 speakers with a Polk sub for an enjoyable near-field listening experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I connected this adapter to a Raspberry Pi 3 and works perfectly. No drivers needed... just Plug & Play. Due to the fact that the analog audio output integrated in RPi3 has a very noticeable amount of static, this USB DAC is a very valuable adapter which provides clear sound.
customer_reviews.author: uvr

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Sound Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a headset and a modmic 5 so it was a hassle connecting that back and forth from my PC to my PS4. Now I can simply disconnect the USB and plug it into either system. Also an added bonus here is that the sound quality actually got better with this sound card, in comparison to my onboard sound card that came with the PC. 10/10 product.
customer_reviews.author: SlickRick

customer_reviews.title: Does just what I need
customer_reviews.text: My sound device on my work laptop stopped working so I bought this as a fix. It really does just plug in and the system recognizes it with no trouble. Tested on a Windows 7 Dell and a Debian Linux Lenovo. I really only need it for calls at work so I didn't rigorously test sound quality. But it works fine for what I need. Did not try to plug in a microphone. It's also nice that it just comes in a little plastic pouch so there is no excessive packaging to throw away. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Great little adapther
customer_reviews.text: My daughter jammed a ink pen into my headphone and mic jacks on the front of my PC and killed them. After looking into my case manufacturer they cannot be replaced and I don't want to buy another case. This allows my to convert my Steel Series gaming headset into usb and got me back in business.
customer_reviews.author: Camdex

customer_reviews.title: This is what Plug N Play is
customer_reviews.text: Well, what's there to say? The build quality is solid, and it does what it said it would do. On Windows 10, there was no driver to install. Very, very easy. And it's a good stop-gap solution if you're $100 earphones crapped out and you need something temp and quick. The sound quality is actually great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Charles

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the Noise crackling i had on my new headset.
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit longer than expected to arrive, however i'm very impressed so far. Sound Clarity has improved. And the crackling is completely gone! I had tried every method to fix my audio issues of my headset crackling. And i heard about this product. What else can i say? works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: FTG_Gattsu

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good ...
customer_reviews.text: The audio out works as expected. I haven't checked the mic input as I don't have a mic that will fit. My use case is as a dedicated sound card for amateur radio digital modes. It was immediately recognized by my Linux computer so I don't expect to have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Winfree

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive alternative if you have a messed up headphone jack on your computer!!
customer_reviews.text: after messing up my audio plug on my desk top i went looking for other cheap options and this lil guy did the trick! works great, just plug it into a USB port in your computer or a hub and plug in your headphones or speakers and off you go. i don't really need the mic port so i haven't tested that.
customer_reviews.author: Edzew Kurai

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain, everything works as it should. My headphone and Microphone works fairly well with the device. However, always remember that this is a portable sound card, so the sounds are flatter and the lows/mids are not as clear as your standard sound card you would typically have in your computer. On the bright side for the microphone port, you'll hear noticeable improvements in sound quality and noise control.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on my new HP Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every configuration possible but i cannot get this microphone USB jack to work. I No sound comes through my lavalier mic... I have made sure the device was selected but I get ZERO . I can't get any help either...
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mac Mini with failing sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix the failing headphone output on an old Mac Mini. It's hard to open one of those up to make a repair, so it's great that this works with USB. There is no driver installation and it just works after you plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin L.

customer_reviews.title: Good USB audio adapter for servers without built in sound cards
customer_reviews.text: I have a HP Proliant ML10 Gen 9 server running Ubuntu server and the desktop user interface. I was amazed to find that the server didn't have any sound card built in! It's nice to have sound if you want to play a video on Ubuntu server configuration for instance. This little adapter gave me what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: decent sound with Windows 10 computers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter to override my laptop's farting sound card. I tested this adapter out on both my Windows 10 desktop and my Windows 10 laptop, and it sounded clear and bassy. update: I just noticed that the low frequency sound is HIGHLY distorted from the headphone output, and it sounds like brushed motor's brushes rubbing on commutators
customer_reviews.author: Andy Y.

customer_reviews.title: sound quality good! and compatible!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a large scale art project with raspberry pis. They were champs and everyone liked the sound quality. I'm not sure I'd put them on a monitor speaker, but this was an art piece and there wasn't discernible hiss or other signal problems.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly. A few years ago I broke off a set of headphones in the jack and while I was able to get the piece of the plug removed it jacked up my headphone jack permanently. I wasn't able to listen to stereo sound and sometimes had to wiggle it just to get any sound. Plugging this adapter in gave me immediate crystal-clear stereo sound. I wish I would have bought this a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Cross
